info.name: Super G+ Crutch
info.additionalInfo: Gentlemen, here we present a little script that aims to improve G+ user experience. It removes right block with suggestions, centers the stream on page, and improves comments readability by changing background to white and text to black. Notice: this script is a crutch. Deal with it. The script is intended to be used with browser window maximized. You probably won't find it useful if you prefer opening G+ in a small separate window. Revision history May 15, 2013 Support discontinued 0.10 (Mar 7, 2013) * Fixed comments being shift left. 0.9 (Mar 6, 2013) + Added an option to change interface of new profile pages. * Partly fixed Communities. * Minor fixes. 0.8 (Jul 1, 2012) + Added an option to have rounded avatars. * Code slightly refactored. * Fixed some bugs. 0.7 (Jun 26, 2012) * Fixed the script after update. 0.6 (May 9, 2012) * Fixed the script that appeared broken after update. 0.5 (Apr 26, 2012) * Changed the way stream is represented. 0.4 * Improved position of stream. - Chat window turned back. 0.3 + Added white background of comments (via +Sir Anthony). 0.2 * Fixed colors of text and links (didn't work for some reason). 0.1 — The very first crutch. + Removed chat. + Removed suggestions. + Centered stream on page. + Changed colors of text and links. TODO: * Fix the communities. * Make chat always collapsable. * Make default page header thinner. * Rewrite code where possible, as for now its look really disappoints me. Tested in Chromium, Google Chrome and Firefox on several GNU/Linux distros, Windows 7, and Windows 8. Brought to you by Jabbering Animates Club.
